learning_objective: Describe how internal and external parts of computing devices function to form a system.
question_str:
{
    "Question": "As an aspiring music producer, Alex is interested in setting up their own home studio to record and produce music. They have a computer, a set of studio headphones, a high-fidelity microphone, and a MIDI keyboard. What piece of hardware might they need to ensure all these devices can interact efficiently and produce high-quality audio recordings?",
    "Answer1": "An extra RAM",
    "Answer2": "An audio interface",
    "Answer3": "A graphics card",
    "Answer4": "An extra hard drive",
    "CorrectAnswer": "2",
    "Explanation": "An audio interface is a critical piece of hardware in a recording setup. It is responsible for converting the analog signals from the microphone into digital signals for the computer to process and vice versa. It also serves as a hub for connecting all audio devices, ensuring they work together seamlessly."
}
